<!--[if lt IE 7]><style type="text/css">body{behavior:url("/w/skins/vector/csshover.min.htc")}</style><![endif]--></head>
<body class="mediawiki ltr sitedir-ltr ns-0 ns-subject page-Virginia skin-vector action-view vector-animateLayout">
		<div id="mw-page-base" class="noprint"></div>
		<div id="mw-head-base" class="noprint"></div>
		<div id="content" class="mw-body" role="main">
			<a id="top"></a>
			<div id="mw-js-message" style="display:none;"></div>
						<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en"><span dir="auto">Virginia</span></h1>
			<div id="bodyContent">
								<div id="siteSub">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
								<div id="contentSub"></div>
												<div id="jump-to-nav" class="mw-jump">
					Jump to:					<a href="#mw-navigation">navigation</a>, 					<a href="#p-search">search</a>
				</div>
				<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><div class="dablink">"The Old Dominion" redirects here. For other uses, see <a href="/w/index.php?title=Old_Dominion_(disambiguation)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Old Dominion (disambiguation) (page does not exist)">Old Dominion (disambiguation)</a>.</div><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Main_other&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Main other (page does not exist)">Template:Main other</a>
<p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:About&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:About (page does not exist)">Template:About</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Use_mdy_dates&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Use mdy dates (page does not exist)">Template:Use mdy dates</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Pp-move-indef&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Pp-move-indef (page does not exist)">Template:Pp-move-indef</a>
{{#invoke:Infobox|infobox}}
<b>Virginia</b> <small>(</small><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:IPAc-en&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:IPAc-en (page does not exist)">Template:IPAc-en</a><small>)</small>, officially the <b>Commonwealth of Virginia</b>, is a <a href="/w/index.php?title=U.S._state&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="U.S. state (page does not exist)">U.S. state</a> located in the <a href="/wiki/South_Atlantic_States" title="South Atlantic States">South Atlantic region</a> of the <a href="/w/index.php?title=United_States&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="United States (page does not exist)">United States</a>. Virginia is nicknamed the "Old Dominion" and the "Mother of Presidents" after the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Lists_of_United_States_Presidents_by_place_of_birth&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lists of United States Presidents by place of birth (page does not exist)">eight U.S. presidents</a> born there. The geography and climate of the Commonwealth are shaped by the <a href="/wiki/Blue_Ridge_Mountains" title="Blue Ridge Mountains">Blue Ridge Mountains</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Chesapeake_Bay" title="Chesapeake Bay">Chesapeake Bay</a>, which provide habitat for much of its flora and fauna. The capital of the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Commonwealth_(U.S._state)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Commonwealth (U.S. state) (page does not exist)">Commonwealth</a> is <a href="/wiki/Richmond,_Virginia" title="Richmond, Virginia">Richmond</a>; <a href="/wiki/Virginia_Beach,_Virginia" title="Virginia Beach, Virginia">Virginia Beach</a> is the most populous city, though <a href="/wiki/Fairfax_County,_Virginia" title="Fairfax County, Virginia">Fairfax County</a> is the most populous political subdivision. The Commonwealth's estimated population is 8,260,405 <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:As_of&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:As of (page does not exist)">Template:As of</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-PopEstUS_1-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PopEstUS-1">[1]</a></sup>
</p><p>The area's history begins with several indigenous groups, including the <a href="/wiki/Powhatan" title="Powhatan">Powhatan</a>. In 1607 the <a href="/wiki/London_Company" title="London Company">London Company</a> established the <a href="/wiki/Colony_of_Virginia" title="Colony of Virginia">Colony of Virginia</a> as the first permanent <a href="/w/index.php?title=New_World&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="New World (page does not exist)">New World</a> <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_England" title="Kingdom of England">English</a> colony. Slave labor and the land acquired from displaced Native American tribes each played a significant role in the colony's early politics and plantation economy. Virginia was one of the <a href="/wiki/Thirteen_Colonies" title="Thirteen Colonies">13 Colonies</a> in the <a href="/wiki/American_Revolution" title="American Revolution">American Revolution</a> and joined the <a href="/wiki/Confederate_States_of_America" title="Confederate States of America">Confederacy</a> in the <a href="/wiki/American_Civil_War" title="American Civil War">American Civil War</a>, during which Richmond was made the Confederate capital and Virginia's northwestern counties <a href="/wiki/Wheeling_Convention" title="Wheeling Convention">seceded</a> to form the state of <a href="/wiki/West_Virginia" title="West Virginia">West Virginia</a>. Although the Commonwealth was under <a href="/wiki/Solid_South" title="Solid South">single-party rule</a> for nearly a century following <a href="/w/index.php?title=Reconstruction_era_of_the_United_States&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Reconstruction era of the United States (page does not exist)">Reconstruction</a>, both major national parties are competitive in modern Virginia.<sup id="cite_ref-purple_2-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-purple-2">[2]</a></sup>
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/Virginia_General_Assembly" title="Virginia General Assembly">Virginia General Assembly</a> is the oldest continuous law-making body in the New World.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3">[3]</a></sup> The state government has been repeatedly ranked most effective by the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Pew_Research_Center&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Pew Research Center (page does not exist)">Pew Center on the States</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-pew_4-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-pew-4">[4]</a></sup> It is unique in how it treats cities and counties equally, manages local roads, and prohibits its governors from serving consecutive terms. Virginia's economy has many sectors: agriculture in the <a href="/wiki/Shenandoah_Valley" title="Shenandoah Valley">Shenandoah Valley</a>; federal agencies in <a href="/wiki/Northern_Virginia" title="Northern Virginia">Northern Virginia</a>, including the headquarters of the <a href="/w/index.php?title=United_States_Department_of_Defense&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="United States Department of Defense (page does not exist)">Department of Defense</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Central_Intelligence_Agency&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Central Intelligence Agency (page does not exist)">CIA</a>; and military facilities in <a href="/wiki/Hampton_Roads" title="Hampton Roads">Hampton Roads</a>, the site of the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Virginia_Port_Authority&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Virginia Port Authority (page does not exist)">region's main seaport</a>. Virginia's public schools and many <a href="/wiki/List_of_colleges_and_universities_in_Virginia" title="List of colleges and universities in Virginia">colleges and universities</a> have contributed to growing media and technology sectors. As a result, <a href="/wiki/Integrated_circuit" title="Integrated circuit">computer chips</a> have become the state's leading export.<sup id="cite_ref-chips_5-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-chips-5">[5]</a></sup>
</p>
<div id="toc" class="toc"><div id="toctitle"><h2>Contents</h2></div>
